title: Pirate Baby's Cabana Battle Street Fight 2006
content:
[url=http://www.selectparks.net/modules.php?name=News&file=article&sid=442]www.selectparks.net/modul...le&sid=442[/url]

[url=http://probertson.livejournal.com/]This guy[/url] does some amazing pixel art stuff. This newest video of his is pretty much the coolest thing I have ever seen. There's lots of violence, octopi, and zombie babies. Check it out.[center]TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS[/center]

title: Re: Pirate Baby's Cabana Battle Street Fight 2006
content: Seriously, check this out, guys.[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Re: Pirate Baby's Cabana Battle Street Fight 2006
content:
I'm sorry man... the name of this topic pushes me to move my mouse cursor in the general direction of the "Back" button. I am sure many people just did the same.

I did check him out though, and I pretty much have nothing to say. I mean... cool link, and that person obviously puts much time and effort into his creations, but... it's pixel art.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img]
It's just not THAT interesting. Just my opinion though.-----------------------
[url=http://Galaxie.Spatang.com][img]http://img360.imageshack.us/img360/548/blegdandsmeegnewbanner2wf.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Pirate Baby's Cabana Battle Street Fight 2006
content: That is pretty good pixel art.  I'm surprised he's Australian too, I wonder what he was saying with that Channel 7 logo?  (At the end of the room with the executives, that "7" is the logo of one of our TV stations.)

title: Uh..
content:
Pretty creepy...

@Malvineous: That logo seems kinda basic, so it'd probably be easy to accidentally make the same one.-Genius314
[url=http://planetck.spatang.com]PlanetCK[/url]

title: Re: Uh..
content:
I love this movie. I just downloaded it the other day. My favorite part, hands down, is the "Now Entering a World of Pain" bit. I saw that, and was like, "No way!" But it was! Walter with a bowling ball. In his element.________________
[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v462/lemur821/toughyorp.png[/img]

title: Hmm.
content: Ooh, I love pixel art. The content sounds kinda lame and mainstream, but it's animated pixel art so I've definitely gotta see it. Gonna take a while to download, though. Are there any screenshots of it in the meantime?

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
Basically, it's a movie that plays like a Street Fighter style beat-'em-up. If you appreciate pixel art on its own and like watching other people play games, you'll probably like it - otherwise, you'll probably find it boring.

I'll add screenshots later when my Ubuntu machine starts playing videos. (Damn Linux and its damn tricky-to-configure media support)[url=http://toxicsheep.com]toxicsheep.com[/url] | [url=http://commanderkeen.org]coming up next...[/url]

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
I compared it to Ninja Turtles for the NES (cos I didn't think street fighter scrolled so far).

I love the soundtrack in this movie.

[quote]Quote:[hr]I'll add screenshots later when my Ubuntu machine starts playing videos. (Damn Linux and its damn tricky-to-configure media support)[hr][/quote]
Might I recommend Mplayer? It worked perfectly for me (although Ubuntu isn't my distro).________________

title: Re: Hmm.
content: I have MPlayer - unfortunately, I broke the Mozilla plugin and now I can't play videos in Firefox, which is a pain.
